listing.listing_description: Located in the Sonalon area and nestled in the heights of Verbier, Chalet Alpin Roc’s elevated position provides breathtaking views of the surrounding mountain peaks and the village below. Just a seven minute drive from the village center and a jaunt to the golf club, enjoy the splendor of a chalet where the shiny green pines meet the chill of white snow. Live it up with Luxury Retreats!Chalet Alpin Roc makes a great beat for any season. Lounge with your favorite tipple in front of a roaring fire or watch the sun set over the mountains while sitting in the soothing bubbles of the outdoor hot tub. Interior perks include a media loft, Wi-Fi and a hammam steam room. A large mezzanine area above the main living area has been set aside as a chill out space and television room with low comfortable sofas. Wi-Fi and a mud room with boot heaters are provided for your convenience. Your reservation includes housekeeping and lift pass delivery service.The wonderfully bright open plan living and dining area is the height of alpine chic. Old wood and natural stones have been successfully combined with contemporary Italian furnishings and Swiss detailing. The modern open plan kitchen is well equipped to cater for a sophisticated soirée or a light lunch. The living area centers around an open fireplace, while large French windows provide the backdrop as the sun sets over Verbier.This private vacation rental is set out over three floors and accommodates eight guests in four exquisite bedrooms. The first floor is home to three bedrooms. The master bedroom, with en-suite bathroom and separate toilet, is located at the front of the property. Also on this floor is a twin/double bedroom and a children’s bunk room, with handmade beds and skylight. The front two bedrooms also have access to the balcony.Verbier stands out as a cosmopolitan and chic playground for celebrities and epicureans alike. This top tier skiing area boasts a fantastic track record of snowfall, great snow retention and a variety of slopes to accommodate all types of skiers, from beginners to the most experienced. Verbier also offers many options for hiking and biking. Ideal for a relaxing holiday with the entire family, a honeymoon or a wedding, the magic of the Swiss Alps awaits!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: The famously luminous sunlight of Venice bounces off the water and into this restored apartment near the Canale Grande. Beamed ceilings and plaster walls speak to the city’s architectural history, but Lucite pieces place it in the now. It’s less than a 10-minute walk to both the Italo-Byzantine splendor of St. Mark’s Basilica and the medical museum at the imposing Scuola Grande di San Marco. This luxury property may feel like a centuries-old palazzo, but it boasts all the amenities of a modern home, from cable TV and Wi-Fi to air conditioning. A dishwasher makes light work of cleaning up after homemade feasts, and laundry facilities make it easy to start fresh on each day of your holiday. Murano chandeliers hanging from wood-beamed ceilings and richly patterned area rugs on the floors give this vacation rental a sense of traditional grandeur. But there’s modern flair in the living and dining rooms, too, thanks to Lucite accent tables and dining chairs around a table for 6. And the fully equipped kitchen is all contemporary, with a galley layout and sleek, high-gloss cabinets. Each of the apartment’s 3 bedrooms has a king bed and air conditioning; 1 has a private ensuite bathroom and the other 2 have shared access to a hall bathroom. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms pair the traditional with the modern with ease, putting streamlined shelves against ornate ceiling moldings and wrought-iron bed frames. A stay at this villa makes it easy to explore the city. Walk 8 minutes to St. Mark’s Basilica, one of the most iconic sights in Venice—if not in Italy—and admire both the swirling ornamentation and the crowds on the piazza outside. The marble-faced Scuola Grande di San Marco, also 8 minutes away, is primarily a hospital but also houses a small medical museum. Bring the family out for cicheti, or little bar bites, or relive your honeymoon over a lengthier dinner at a canal-side restaurant. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Formerly a schoolhouse, this minimalistic villa is where you’ll delightfully disconnect while basking in the warm afternoon sun and fragrant Tuscan greenery. Mature Cypresses, Pines, and Cedars create a secluded atmosphere, perfect for sunbathing, alfresco dinners, and private parties. Rejuvenate in the thermal spas of San Casciano Dei Bagni before heading to explore the cobblestone streets of Cetona. Light the lanterns that surround the swimming pool, outdoor lounge, and alfresco dining area to set the tone for a fun night in with friends. Rather a quiet evening? Get a fire going inside, find a good movie on satellite television, and let the countryside breeze wash over you as you curl up under a blanket on the sofa. Then, retreat to master bedroom’s 4-post bed or relax in the ensuite’s stone bathtub.Stretch out on a poolside sun lounger while the kids play soccer on the lawn, maybe pop in for a lap or two if you’re keeping up with your fitness routine. Then, book yourself a massage or in-house spa service. Keep the relaxation going and skip dinner prep; there are a bunch of great add-ons available, including chef services, grocery delivery, and more.Start your day in Cetona with a coffee at one of the cafes lining Piazza Garibaldi, the 16th-century town square. From there, follow ancient streets to discover inspiring architecture and authentic Sienese and Tuscan restaurants. Mount Cetona is home to 3 historical museums, covering the Paleolithic to the Bronze Age. Rome, Siena, and Florence are all drivable within an hour or 2. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: Take a visit to the reknowned thermal spa in San Casciano dei Bagni. It was the Etruscans who first discovered the healing properties of the thermal waters in Val d'Orcia. In the 17th century, the renowned Medici family built a series of baths, which have been reborn as a luxurious new spa featured in Travel & Leisure.

The enchanting town of Cetona will charm you with its cobblestone streets and medieval architecture. This lovely village has grown in popularity as a home for international artists and socialites. Stop for an exquisite lunch or dinner at Osteria Vecchia (so good!)—you won't be disappointed.
Definitely worth a visit are Orvieto, Assisi and Todi. Head to Deruta to shop for the renowned local ceramics. Last but not least, make sure to check out the chocolate museum in Perugia!

listing.listing_address: San Casciano dei Bagni, Siena, Italy

listing.listing_description: Touch Tuscany’s traditional country life with this beautifully restored farmhouse dating from the early 16th century. Retaining the same centuries-old exterior, the villa now has complete modern decor, AC and all mod cons. A sloped garden leads to a pool and garden tower, offering 360 degree views. Majestic ruins, impressive castles and charming hilltop restaurants abound within a short drive. Guests will arrive at Podere Capannelle via the Val d'Orcia, a region of naturally-sculpted ridges and tranquil hillsides that have been protected as a UNESCO World Heritage site. Entering the huge, sunlit driveway, the light-coloured stone and blue shutters of the farmhouse offer a vision of old-school charm. Ascend the exterior staircase to enter thoughtfully outfitted rooms, which are furnished with nod after nod to Italian styling, from the luscious leather furniture, to the craftsman-worked wooden tables and fittings, to the rich marble utilized in the home’s numerous and stylish ensuite bathrooms. Take in serene views of the quiet countryside from the beautifully-maintained garden that surrounds the home, stroll the expansive lawns and pathways adjacent to the house, or lounge in the poolside sun-recliners or covered dining area.Podere Capannelle is ideally positioned for those looking to enjoy the riches and unique atmosphere of the Tuscan countryside. From the towering Fortezza di Radicofani that dominates the nearby village, to the quiet lanes, secluded village squares and old-world cafes that dot the nearby communes, guests can take to the roads by bike or car and fall under the ancient spell of this part of Italy. With good proximity to the Riserva Naturale Monte Rufeno, guests can visit the largest natural parc in Umbria, complete with stunning mountain views and towering waterfalls. Return after each day trip to a flavoursome glass of local chianti on the sunset terrace, as the light turns golden on the nearby hills.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Step out from the shade of this spacious old-world Italian townhouse, and instantly feel the sunshine and sea breeze of southern Sicily. Designed to the aesthetics of this historic region, guests will love the tiered pool, airy upper terrace and story-book bedroom balconies. With easy access to one of Avola’s best beaches, Palazzo Calea is ideal for embracing the laid-back spirit of Italian summers. With cool, lofty bedrooms, guests can awake and throw open the upper level doors, effortlessly letting in the light and air of the Mediterrean. Located just a short walk from the beach, a plunge into the private pool or an afternoon spent sun-dozing in the bright garden is just what’s required after morning on the hot sands. With modern, open and bright interiors, enjoying a mid-day coffee or the rich taste of a nightcap grappa on the shaded upper terrace is a particular pleasure - as is grilling freshly-caught fish on the villa’s complimentary barbecue. Step outside this listing, and you’ll soon find yourself immersed in the rich historic and culinary aspects of Sicily. Within a few minutes walk, the open piazzas of Avola await, with charming cafes and the very freshest of seafood and life-affirming Italian cuisine. Take a walk along the town’s calming promenade or amongst the famed almond groves of the surrounding hillsides, or explore the layered history of this most ancient part of the Medditerrean, following in the footsteps of the Greeks, Romans, Moors, and others, who have left their own unique marks on the landscape of the region. Finally, relax under the shaded table in the villa’s courtyard, tasting the sweetness of a Nero d’Avola, the unique red wine named after this seaside city. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Step into a Tuscan dream at Villa Marciano. This vacation rental in the Florence area ticks all the boxes: stunning views of vineyards and olive groves with San Gimignano on the horizon, quintessential farmhouse charm and modern amenities for a luxury experience. Reserve the property’s seven bedrooms for a family reunion, a milestone celebration with friends or a truly intimate destination wedding in the Italian countryside.Take in the views from the sun-splashed terrace by the infinity pool or sample local wines around an al-fresco dining table for fourteen. The villa also has satellite TV, Wi-Fi and a fireplace for cozy evenings in. Daily housekeeping and cook service is available at extra cost.Though the villa was once a farmhouse, it’s now a comfortable modern residence. The sitting and dining rooms still feature high beamed ceilings and terracotta floors alongside graceful seating and elegant accent tables. The separate kitchen is sleek and fully equipped with chef-worthy appliances.Each of the seven bedrooms at Villa Marciano has a queen bed, en-suite bathroom and air conditioning. Several of the beds can be arranged as two twin beds if desired. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms are classic Tuscany: terracotta floors, beamed ceilings and soft-hued walls.Spend your stay taking a honeymoon from the everyday at the villa or exploring the area. It’s only a 15-minute drive from San Donato in Poggio and Castellina in Chianti, two must-see medieval towns, and there are plenty of wineries where you can stop off for a tasting on your way. It’s well worth planning a day trip into the cities of Florence or Siena, both about a 45-minute drive from the villa, for their architecture, culture and cuisine.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: From the views outside to the playful artwork inside, it’s all about the mountains at this traditional ski chalet. Tucked into a grove of pines on a slope overlooking the peaks, this wood-paneled lodge is a cozy haven with a sauna, storage, and more to help you get ready for the next day on the slopes. Even the location puts you a 5-minute drive from the Mont-Blanc Chamonix runs. Leave gear in the dedicated ski storage area and stretch out in the private home gym, then give yourself the luxury of a session in the indoor sauna or a soak in the outdoor hot tub. Once your muscles are soothed, settle in for the evening by the fireplace. Even if it’s too dark to see the mountains outside, spot them on the walls of the two living rooms at this vacation rental. Try out France’s famed cheeses and wines around a dining table for 8, or pause at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen to sip a cup from the Nespresso machine. The snug vibe extends to bedrooms with wood-beamed ceilings and fur throws. If you want to spend your holiday on the slopes, it’s 5 minutes to the nearest ski area—and 6 minutes to downtown Chamonix for your après. Bring the whole family to Domaine des Planards for a ride on the alpine coaster or a first-time ski session in their beginners’ area, or relive your honeymoon over dinner at a Michelin-starred restaurant. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Steal away to a private setting to revel in the Algarvian sunshine at Villa M49. Part of Pine Cliffs, a Luxury Collection Resort, this beautifully appointed vacation rental is a modern haven just minutes from the beach. Take advantage of the resort's shared amenities for an active family holiday, or hide out at the villa for a honeymoon-style romantic escape.Spend days relaxing around the villa's pool in al-fresco living areas with an ample supply of loungers, a barbecue, outdoor dining for eight and a hot tub. In the evenings, gather around the indoor wood-burning fireplace or TV and DVD player, or keep in touch with friends and family at home via Wi-Fi.The bright, contemporary living spaces at Villa M49 stretch out parallel to the pool terrace, flooded with light by walls of doors and windows. Marbled stone floors are a sophisticated base for the sleek furnishings in the living room, while in the formal dining room, a brick ceiling adds a touch of coziness and warmth. In the fully equipped kitchen, you'll find conveniences such as an espresso machine as well as a breakfast table.The villa's four bedrooms can accommodate groups of up to eight. There are three bedrooms with queen beds and en-suite bathrooms, two of which open to balconies, and one bedroom with two twin beds, an en-suite bathroom and terrace access.Guests of Villa M49 are welcome at the beach and health clubs, games room, indoor and outdoor pools, driving range and golf course at Pine Cliffs; additional costs may apply to some activities. Bring the whole family to the mini-golf course, rent bicycles and pedal around the area, or borrow water sports equipment for a beach day. Luckily, the Central Algarve location puts you just minutes from the dramatic cliffs and golden sands of beaches like Praia de Falésia.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: If you’ve been dreaming of Tuscany, make your fantasies reality at Il Prato di Vignamaggio. Quaint and charming, this vacation rental in the Chianti countryside has it all: views of rolling hills, vineyards in operation for more than 600 years, and the sort of stone buildings that have dotted the area since the Renaissance. Step into the tradition and make the estate’s history part of your own memories.Upon your arrival, a welcome basket and guided tour of Vignamaggio will quickly introduce you to the estate’s spirit of relaxed luxury. Il Prato, which translates roughly to “meadow,” is an oasis within the Vignamaggio estate, set amid lush lawns and private grounds where you’ll find a pool, plenty of loungers in the sun, a barbecue and an al-fresco dining area. The property may have a long and distinguished heritage, but it also has modern amenities from an exercise room and hammam to a TV and Wi-Fi.There are two buildings at Il Prato: the main farmhouse, La Colonica; Il Cottage, framed by cherry and fig trees. Though many traditional features remain, such as the stone exterior walls, beamed ceilings and cotto floors, the houses’ living spaces feel fresh and bright thanks to pieces like slipcovered sofas and ladder-back dining chairs. Gather around the fireplaces in the living rooms for a chat, or at the tables in one of the two fully equipped kitchens for a snack and a glass of wine.There are six bedrooms in La Colonica and two in Il Cottage, all eight with en-suite bathrooms. La Colonica has two king bedrooms, two with double beds and two with two twin beds each. In Il Cottage, you’ll find one bedroom with a king bed and one with two twin beds. The eight bedrooms at Il Prato can accommodate up to sixteen friends and family members on holiday together.Guests of Il Prato are welcome to book a wellness treatment, cooking course or private dinner with the chef at Vignamaggio. Explore the estate on foot or by bike, winding through forests, olive groves and vineyards, or take a drive to Florence or Siena for a day trip. Having featured in the 1993 film Much Ado About Nothing, Vignamaggio makes an idyllic setting for an Italian country wedding—or a romantic honeymoon.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This spectacular villa on the Amalfi Coast is a short walk from the beach at Marina di Praia, and about nine kilometers from Positano. The multi-story home was built gracefully into the cliffs above the sea, with multiple balconies and terraces in the sun and shade, a lovely alfresco dining area, and an open-air plunge pool gazing out at the vast horizon. The interiors are comfortable and elegant, with stylish furnishings, high-end media features, and a gourmet kitchen. All five bedroom suites enjoy breathtaking sea views, ensuite bathrooms, and balcony access, offering ideal accommodations for families and groups of friends up to ten in size.Nestled amid lush gardens and trees, the villa’s ample terraces inspire long days and evenings in the Mediterranean breeze. Soothe your body in the plunge pool and bask in the sunlight on lovely lounge chairs. Returning from the beach in the afternoon, rinse in the alfresco shower and savor a siesta in the dappled shade of citrus trees. Relish home-cooked meals at the table for ten, and sip delicious wine in the outdoor lounge as the sunset transforms the sea and sky.Inside, the beautiful symphony of tones includes black-and-white floor tile, rich wood cabinetry, and a superb timber dining table extending from the kitchen island. The TV den offers a cozy retreat for afternoon downtime or late-night movies. Heating and air conditioning ensure comfort in all seasons.The bedrooms are located on the lower floor, each with a double bed, ensuite bathroom, deluxe linens, and access to the expansive balcony—a lovely spot for morning coffee or quiet relaxation. The rooms' luminous white surfaces, touches of sea-inspired color, and gorgeous stone thresholds harmonize with the sublime surroundings.Villa Don Pietro is ideally positioned for exploring the splendors of the Amalfi Coast, within easy reach of Positano, Amalfi town, and the breathtaking fjord at Furore. Drive about seventeen kilometers to the extraordinary town of Ravello, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that has attracted famous travelers for centuries. Boat trips to the islands of Capri, Ischia, and Procida embark from Positano, Amalfi, and Sorrento. You're an easy car trip from the treasures of Pompeii.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Experience both the tranquil and lively sides of Ibiza at Villa Idurre. This brand-new vacation rental is located in a quiet residential neighborhood just outside the village of San Lorenzo, and feels like a private retreat in the countryside. But with Ibiza town, shopping and dining, and an array of beaches only a short drive away, it’s easy to take advantage of all the island has to offer.This gated property has a lovely garden with panoramic views and an expansive pool and terrace. Stretch out in the sun on one of the loungers placed along the length of the pool, or enjoy the shade of the Balinese-style daybed or covered sitting area. Heat up the barbecue and linger around the al-fresco dining area, or step inside and serve refreshments to family and friends from the wine fridge around the cozy wood-burning fireplace.Though this luxury villa is newly built, it has the architectural charm of a traditional estate. Massive wooden entry doors give way to interiors with thick stucco walls and wood-beamed ceilings, and the ladder-back chairs in the dining area could have come from a local farm. But the villa also has a modern side, from the sleek sofas in the entry and TV lounge to the fabulous stone countertops in the fully equipped kitchen.There are four bedrooms in the main house at Villa Idurre and one in a separate guest house. The main house has a master bedroom with a king bed and en-suite bathroom, one bedroom with a double bed and en-suite, and two bedrooms with two twin beds each, one of which has an en-suite. The guest house, which could be used as a honeymoon suite or a tucked-away escape for in-laws, has a king bed, en-suite bathroom, and its own kitchenette and living area.Ibiza may be known for its nightlife, but a holiday on the island can be relaxing as well. Take time to explore the oceanfront towns of Portinatx or Santa Eularia des Riu, or spend a day soaking in the sun and scenery on the nearby beaches of Cala Benirras, Puerto San Miguel, Cala San Vicente and Cala Xarraca. Of course, it’s easy to spend an unforgettable night out in Ibiza town, only a 15-minute drive from Villa Idurre.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Villa Catalina is an exquisitely renovated villa set in rural Sitges, Barcelona. It is set within 400 acres of private secluded grounds offering spectacular views of the Penedés Wine region.This spacious and beautifully established terracotta colored villa features restful living areas, traditional shuttered windows and tiled flooring. It’s relaxed rustic outward appearance contrasts with its luxurious indoor spaces. The villa is well equipped to handle large groups and has ample spaces for your party to spread out. There is a spacious fully equipped kitchen and handsome dining area for up to 30. Should you wish to relax inside there’s a satellite TV, DVD player, CD and Wi-Fi and fitness room. Why not challenge someone to a game of table tennis or football or try out the video gaming?Your extensive outside facilities include private swimming pool, a large patio and lounging area, al fresco dining area with seating for 18 and al fresco boardroom. There is also a barbeque with children’s play area. The property also features a unique traditional Catalan stone shepherd's hut. Villa Catalina is an ideal venue for a wedding or a corporate event. It features a gorgeous Bodega that sits 150 people. The garden and pool area can also accommodate a large group of up to 300. At additional cost and with advance notice staffing and catering can be provided.Villa Catalina can accommodate up to 30 guests overnight in its 15 gorgeous bedrooms, nine include en-suite facilities. All bedrooms include air conditioning and heating for the colder months.Penedes is a natural and historical region of the autonomous community of Catalonia and is located in the south of the Principality of Catalonia between the pre-coastal mountain range, the Serralada Pre-litoral and the Mediterranean. This wine-producing region is framed by the coastal hills of the Serra del Garraf and the higher inland mountains, which skirt the Catalan Central Depression. It is considered to be one of the country’s best wine-producing regions, better known for its Cava production, a sparking wine, although the region also produces some highly regarded, oak-aged reds.It is 4 km to Sitges Golf Course and 8 km to tennis court at Centre Esportiu Vallpineda. 12 km to Club de Golf Terramar and 20 km to Barcelona Ferry PortAnd 46 km drive to Barcelona. La Molina ski slopes are 80 km away. It is 8 km to Sitges Beach and 10 km to San Sebastian Beach. The Barcelona–El Prat Airport (BCN) is 30 km.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.Read more about this villa in our magazine (http://magazine.luxuryretreats.com/villa-catalina-villa-in-sitges/)Permit: HUTB-012348

listing.listing_description: Overlooking Rio di San Polo from the piano nobile of Palazzo Morosini, this modern Venetian apartment is right in the heart of Venice. Gaze out the living room windows to watch people on the streets below and gondolas floating by in the canal. When you’re ready to join the action, start with a walk to St. Mark’s Basilica, you’ll pass a few other notable sites along the way. Venice is a city known for its lack of space; this is not the case in Coriandolo. A minimalistic great room, containing an eat-in kitchen flows over to the Smart TV lounge, with scenic windows along the riverside wall. Thoughtful placement of the bedrooms on either side of the living room creates a little extra-privacy. And, each ensuite is finished with high-end fixtures and Venetian marble. It may not look it from the outside, delightfully so, but Coriandolo has some great tech-features, like heated floors, an integrated sound system, and Wi-Fi. During your stay, you’ll have access to the communal gardens and outdoor kitchen, as well as a helpful list of add-ons. The kitchen may be small, but it comes with everything you’ll need, including a dishwasher and Nespresso machine. Rialto Market is a great place to stock your pantry. If you’d like to taste the freshest local produce without doing any of the leg work, stop in at Osteria All’ Arco. It’s just down the street from the market, where nearly all of the restaurant’s ingredients are purchased daily. Feel like a drink, check out one of Hemingway’s favorites, Harry’s Bar, it’s also the birthplace of the Bellini. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Bice is a luxury villa located approximately a one hour drive west of Florence. Its spacious open plan on the ground floor, the five generous en-suite bedrooms and its vicinity to a impressive 18-hole golf course make this property the ideal spot for family and friends who want to enjoy the beauty of this area of Italy. From wine tastings to beach fun, as well as a rich culture and history, you will find it all in Tuscany!Cool off in the pristine waters of the immaculate swimming pool with nothing but the green pastoral countryside of Tuscany in your gaze. The grounds feature an ample terrace with plenty of lounging in sun or shade. How about some alfresco dining for a change of pace? Indoors, you will find satellite television and Wi-Fi. The villa has also been decked out with a pizza oven and fitness room – so feel free to work off any indulgences of the day! Your reservation includes housekeeping.The villa features ample social spaces, all very well appointed. The beautiful terracotta or wooden floors, the stunning vaulted brick ceilings, the marble used in many rooms and the expensive fixtures provide understated elegance while creating a welcoming ambience. Great comfort and contemporary decor await the discerning traveler at Bice. The open plan dining and living area with a fireplace makes a stunning setting in which to share an epic announcement with your group. The dining area also leads directly to the kitchen with a center island breakfast bar.Five exquisite bedrooms accommodate up to ten guests at Bice. All of the bedrooms include queen size beds and en-suite bathrooms. Only the finest linens, bedding and accoutrements have been included to ensure the ultimate comfort of our illustrious guests.During your stay at Bice, you will be just a twenty-five minute drive away from Livorno Beach, whose white sands and turquoise waters have made it one of the top ranked strands in all of Tuscany. Montaione itself – the particular area in which this villa is located – is known for its many historical buildings including castles and churches, in addition to the Italian Horse Protection animal sanctuary. Although Tuscan cuisine is itself quite simple, focusing on natural flavors, perhaps therein lies some part of the secret to what Italians call la dolce vita, or living ‘the sweet life.’Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: If you’ve come to Italy for the views, look no further than Villa Alfieri. The restored stone country house has gorgeous views of the Tuscan countryside and medieval city of Siena, and plenty of outdoor space from which to admire them, from a shaded pergola to a lawn around the pool. Inside, magazine-worthy decor creates a refined yet comfortable ambience.The U-shaped villa surrounds a central courtyard, but the manicured garden beyond also beckons. Start the day with an espresso under the pergola, then move to the pool to take a dip or just relax on a lounger and listen to the waterfall. End with a glass of wine on the second-floor loggia and a movie via satellite television or Wi-Fi; there’s even air conditioning to keep you comfortable all night.The interiors combine striking contemporary design, like the sleek white stucco fireplace in the spacious living, with the best of classic Tuscan style, like stone walls and vaulted brick ceilings in one of the two dining rooms. The fully equipped kitchen pairs the rustic charm of beamed ceilings and sage green accents with modern touches like stone countertops.Each of Villa Alfieri's five airy bedrooms has its own marble bathroom. The master suite has a king bed and two bathrooms: one with shower and one with tub. Two more bedrooms also have king beds and en-suite bathrooms; one has a walk-in closet as well. The remaining two bedrooms each have a queen bed, and one has an en-suite bathroom while the other has a private bathroom. For families traveling with children, an additional bedroom can be set up with two twin beds and a shared bathroom.A daily continental breakfast is included in the rental, but if you’re curious about regional specialties, you can request a dinner prepared by a local cook. Work off the Tuscan cuisine at the tennis court, a 15 minute drive away, or the golf course and riding stables, a 30 minute drive away. Explore the gardens of the Villa di Geggiano, the estate to which Villa Alfieri once belonged, and don’t miss a nearby 14th century convent. Plus, Siena is just 9.6 km away by car, and the Florence airport only 88.5 km away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: At Extra Cost – advance notice may be required:

Villa Alfieri has been featured in famous Italian interior design magazines such as Casa Vogue, Case di Campagna, and La Cascina Toscana. Its spectacular views are among the best in the region. Among the great services Villa Alfieri has to offer, guests can enjoy typical Tuscan cuisine prepared by a local cook. Due to its location Villa Alfieri is blessed with a breeze from the north, and the house is cool because of its stone construction.

Villa Alfieri once belonged to a larger estate: the splendid Villa di Geggiano which sits nearby. Renowned for its elegance, Villa di Geggiano is not normally open to the public, but don't miss a visit to its spectacular gardens. Also very close by is the majestic Certosa di Pontignano, a convent dating back to 1343. The architecture is organized around three cloisters, which differ in size and period. The first, Certosa, is characterized by a simply worked but beautiful stone well. The related church, decorated with paintings by Poccetti and Francesco Vanni, is open to the public on Sundays. The middle cloister, constructed of brick and housing 17th century frescoes, is the largest and most impressive of all.
feature.strong: What to do in the Siena region of Tuscany?
feature.p: The medieval town of Siena was founded by the Etruscans and later became a Roman colony. During the 13th and 14th centuries it flourished as one of the major cities of Europe, growing rich from banking and the wool trade. The 14th century saw a great amount of construction: the Duomo, the Palazzo Publico and the Campo Square were all products of this time. Siena's glory took a tragic downturn by the end of the 14th century due to the Black Death and political upheaval. The city became little more than a rural market center. It was exactly this decline that accounts for the incredible state of medieval preservation that Siena exhibits today. Built across several hills and valleys, you will find a bit of up and down while walking through the historical center. However, the lack of traffic makes it a wonderful place to stroll—even when packed with tourists, there is a quiet and easygoing feel. A must-see is the shell-shaped square called Il Campo. This is the focal point of the city as well as being the venue for the internationally renowned horse race, the Palio.

Casole d'Elsa hosts one of the most charming museums of the many recently opened/restyled in Siena. The art exhibited ranges from the Neolithic era to the XVII century. A visit to the attached Collegiata di Casole is also highly recommended.

Colle Val d'Elsa's newer outskirts offer very few attractions, aside from the crystal manufacturing—but the old town/historical center, Colle Alta, deserves to be seen. Particularly interesting in Colle Alta is the Palazzo Campana, built in the XVI century by the architect Agnolo di Baccio d'Agnolo. This private building looks like a city gate, or a triumphal arch, and dominates the main street of Colle. The Cathedral shows a rich collection of paintings from the XVII century. Don't miss the dramatic and intense Nativity by Rutilio Manetti (fourth chapel on the right, looking to the main altar).

listing.listing_description: This spectacular chalet is located in the heart of Chamonix-Mont Blanc, the jewel of the French Alps, just two kilometers from both Chamonix Village and the Brévent-Flégère ski slope. The chalet features sublime vistas of the Mont Blanc massif, beautiful outdoor and indoor living areas, and high-end amenities including an outdoor hot tub, a gourmet kitchen, and a stunning, mountain-view sauna. Services include daily housekeeping, complimentary shuttle service to the ski slopes, and chef-prepared meals. Five bedrooms provide comfortable accommodations for adults and kids, making Chalet Mont Blanc an ideal choice for families.The chalet's open-concept great room is ideal for après-ski relaxation and festivities. Vaulted wood ceilings with exposed beams conjure a quintessential alpine ambiance, while ample windows infuse the space with abundant natural light and extraordinary views. Enjoy warm drinks in the lounge while watching your favorite shows on the Apple TV, and gather for hearty meals at the table for eight. Step onto the deck to breathe the mountain air, enjoying your meals alfresco in the warmer months.Perhaps the chalet's most exceptional amenity is the barrel-shaped sauna on the ground floor, featuring ample seating, natural wood paneling, and an extraordinary circular window framing the mountains. Beside the sauna, the open-air hot tub invites you to soothing dips under the mountain sky, while a hammock welcomes afternoon siestas in the fragrant air.The master bedroom includes a queen bed and opens directly to the lower terrace, giving you easy access to the spa area. Its ensuite bathroom features a dual vanity and rain shower. There are three guestrooms with pairs of twin beds; two enjoy ensuite bathrooms while the third shares a bathroom with the children's bunk room. The latter two rooms open to the spa terrace as well.The location of Chalet Mont Blanc offers a prime balance of serene seclusion and convenient access to the splendors of Chamonix-Mont Blanc. Skiers are within easy reach of Brévent-Flégère, Grands Montets, Balme Vallorcine, and Les Houches, while mountaineers and hikers can travel twelve kilometers to the spectacular Aiguille Verte. The world-class dining, nightlife, and cultural riches of Chamonix Village are just a few minutes away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: The pointed top of St. Mark’s Campanile rises above the rooftops in the views from this colorful apartment in the Incurabili neighborhood. While its influences are international—Moorish mirrors, Moroccan blue walls, and iconic British wallpaper—its soul is Venetian, from its original wrought-iron railing to its sun-splashed altana terrace. Walk 1 minute to the Gallerie dell’Accademia’s paintings. Start holiday mornings with a cup from the villa’s Nespresso machine before you set out on foot or by vaporetto. After a day exploring the city, open a bottle of wine on the private terrace to sip as the sun goes down, or unwind with the help of the cable TV and Wi-Fi. The apartment is air conditioned to keep you comfortable on Italy’s warmest days and has laundry facilities. Step through a doorway off Calle Navaro and follow the stairs up to this luxury property. Its first floor features a living room, dining room, and fully equipped kitchen with chic details such as eau-de-nil plaster walls, classic palm-print wallpaper, and whitewashed beamed ceilings. The second floor has a second living room as well as the terrace. This vacation rental has one bedroom with a queen bed and en-suite bathroom, and two bedrooms that each have a king bed and shared access to a hall bathroom. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms are air conditioned and have the richly hued plaster walls so characteristic of Venice. The villa is a 1-minute walk from the Italian masterworks that fill the Gallerie dell’Accademia, and a 7-minute walk from the banks of the Canale Grande. You’ll also find plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance, from the family friendly to the honeymoon-worthy. But it’s also a short trip on foot to several vaporetto, or water bus, stops, from which you can travel to St. Mark’s Square and the base of that campanile seen from your terrace. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: A stay at Villa Laura is your chance to live out your own Under the Tuscan Sun. This ten-bedroom property played the role of the villa Bramasole in the film. Just as the fictional villa is given a makeover, Villa Laura was recently renovated with an eye to traditional style and touches of quiet luxury. Airy and spacious, it offers a Hollywood-worthy retreat in the Tuscan countryside near the town of Cortona.Your vacation at Villa Laura can be as relaxing or active as you like. Stroll the grounds and explore the lake, take a swim in the pool or a dip in the jetted tub, try your luck at ping pong, bocce and a pool table or cook up produce from the local market in the pizza oven or outdoor barbecue. If you’d rather just unwind, you can sunbathe on the lawn, sip wine from the wine cellar at the outdoor dining area, enjoy a quiet evening in the games room or home theater or browse via Wi-Fi.Inside the villa’s centuries-old stone walls, you’ll find bright, traditional living spaces. The living room’s rustic beamed ceilings and tile floors are given a lift of understated elegance by soft green upholstery, a gallery wall and a crystal chandelier. The comfortable, neutral-toned dining room welcomes everyone with its long table, and is open to the well-equipped modern kitchen, which is laid out around a large stone-topped island.The villa’s ten bedrooms are divided between the main house, farmhouse and conservatory; each has an en-suite bathroom, air conditioning and Wi-Fi access. In the main house, there are four bedrooms with king beds and one with a queen bed, easily accessible on the ground floor. In the farmhouse, you’ll find two bedrooms with queen beds, one bedroom with a king bed and one bedroom with two twin beds. The conservatory, or limonaia, has one bedroom with a queen bed.A true Tuscan experience wouldn’t be complete without a trip into town. Luckily, it’s only a 15-minute walk or a 5-minute drive from Villa Laura to the town of Cortona, where you’ll find a grocery store, restaurant, tennis court, clinic, exercise room and train station. Take a day trip to the Lake Trasimento beach, 15 minutes away, or even a ski area, a 2-hour drive away. Pack your clubs for a round at the golf course, 30 minutes away. It’s an easy 40-minute drive to or from the nearest airport, in Perugia.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take a ski holiday like a rock star at Heinz Julen Loft. This one-of-a-kind Zermatt vacation rental breaks away from traditional Swiss Alps architecture and uses glass, steel, polished concrete and ultra-modern furnishings to create a contemporary space like none other. It’s a unique destination for a break with family, a getaway with friends or even a honeymoon in the mountains.The loft is available on a self-catered basis, which includes firewood, or a fully catered basis, which includes breakfast and dinner on six days out of seven, as well as dedicated service by the villa’s staff. After a day out on the slopes, soothe muscles in the sauna and hot tub, give an impromptu concert on the grand piano, share photos via Wi-Fi or put a few logs in the fireplace and settle in by the television.A stay at the loft feels like peeking into a private home, thanks to the distinctive collections of books and artwork that fill the space. The villa is laid out around a main floor with living and dining areas that feature portable seating and even a table that can be raised or lowered as you wish. Climb the stairs or take the elevator to the mezzanine level to find the fully equipped kitchen and a bar area.Each of the three bedrooms at this luxury property has a double bed and an en-suite bathroom. There is one bedroom on the main level, one on the mezzanine and one master suite that takes up the entire top floor of the villa.While no cars are allowed in Zermatt, you’ll hardly need one as the villa is close to ski lifts, shopping and dining. Heinz Julen Loft is only a 2-minute walk from the Omnia Hotel lift and an 8-minute walk from another ski lift. You can also walk to the town’s main street, which is lined with boutiques, restaurants and bars.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Masseria Oliva is a beautifully restored villa in Italy’s Apulia region, along the Adriatic coast, minutes from the beach and the famed town of Ostuni. Nestled amid olive groves that stretch toward the sea, the classic masseria (a type of fortified farmhouse native to the region) was originally built in the 1860s. The current owners have maintained the villa's antique charm while updating it with superb modern amenities for cooking, dining, and relaxation. The walled estate includes a large swimming pool, beautiful alfresco dining patios, a citrus grove, and a vegetable garden. Three charming bedrooms provide comfortable accommodations for six guests.The villa is set amid the classic dry-stone walls native to the region, with gorgeous views over the coastal landscape. Savor a dip in the sparkling pool and bask in the sunlight on lovely lounge chairs. Kindle the barbeque in the afternoon and relish a delicious lunch on the beautiful, vine-clad patio. Sip digestivi at the bar, and linger outdoors in the enchanting Puglian evening.Multiple sets of French doors invite dreamy views and garden-scented breezes into the home. The kitchen is fully equipped for the contemporary gourmet, and easily serves both the interior and alfresco dining areas. The beautifully furnished living room is ideal for savoring a bottle of wine together in the tranquil night. Contemporary features include Apple TV, a Hi-Fi sound system, Wi-Fi, a washer/dryer, and a home office. An underground heating and cooling system keeps you comfortable at all times of year.All three rooms have double-size beds (one of which can be converted into two single-size beds), along with ensuite bathrooms. There is also an additional room with a single-size bed and ensuite bathroom, ideal for a nanny or extra guest.Located on the Fasano-Ostuni road, the villa is perfectly situated for exploring the villages and beaches of Puglia and the Salento. You’re just five kilometers from Ceglie Messapica and seven from the famed “white city” (Citta Bianca) of Ostuni. The beaches and seaside dining at Rosa Marina, Torre Santa Sabina, and Torre Canne are minutes away, and you're about a half-hour from the sublime Valle d’Itria.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Old and new meet in dramatic fashion at the stunning Maude. Originally built to produce wine, this charming stone villa was recently renovated with a contemporary eye to create a memorable contrast between historic Sicilian architecture and modern Italian style. Set in a quiet garden a short drive from the nearest town, this luxury four-bedroom vacation rental makes a gorgeous backdrop for an intimate wedding, indulgent honeymoon or family reunion, or a wonderfully convenient base for exploring the Catania area.The villa’s rugged stone walls and lush trees create a private oasis that’s laid out around a heated saltwater infinity pool. Spend your holiday at Maude lounging by the pool, resting in the shade of the glass-walled sunroom or strolling around the manicured grounds. Rinse off in the outdoor shower before heating up the barbecue to try out local seafood, selecting a glass from the indoor wine fridge and sitting down at the al-fresco dining area, next to an original well. Though the property has plenty of historic charm, it also has plenty of modern perks, from air conditioning to Wi-Fi.Inside the villa, stone walls meet panes of glass, and a sleek fireplace shares space with a fresco-style painted ceiling in an imaginative blend of ancient and contemporary. White floors and walls create a gallery-like atmosphere for traditional details and sculptural furnishings, from a stretched-out sectional and farmhouse-style wooden dining table to yellow Masters dining chairs. The fresh, monochromatic color scheme continues in the fully equipped kitchen.Each of the four bedrooms at Maude has a queen bed; there are three with en-suite bathrooms and one with a shared bathroom. Not only do the bedrooms have the same lively mix of traditional rustic architecture and colorful, iconic modern pieces, but most have extras such as a walk-in closet or a sitting area and fridge.From the villa’s setting on the slopes of Mount Etna, it’s easy to explore the vineyards, countryside and beaches of Sicily. Explore the streets of the seaside city of Acireale, 10 km away, indulge in an oceanfront dinner in Catania, 17 km away, or follow a trail up the mountain, 21 km away, if you dare. It’s also worth taking a day trip to see the port of Messina, 87 km away, or the Greek ruins in Syracuse, 88 km away. At the end of your trip, plan on a 36 km drive from Maude to Catania International Airport.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Swim in the Aegean Sea at Katafygi Beach and return on foot to alfresco feasts at this stunning villa in Sounio along the Athens Riviera. Newly built, the architectural masterwork consists of 2 independent houses, each with a swimming pool, gourmet kitchen, living/dining area, and private entrance. Together they form the perfect seaside haven for a reunion with family or friends, just minutes from Cape Sounio and about 45 kilometers from central Athens.The tiered pool terraces gaze out on sweeping views of the southern Attic coastline and the Saronic Gulf. A shared entertainment area is perched beneath a pergola on the upper terrace, with a barbecue, dining table, and bar. The edge of Katafygi Beach is just steps from the property.Stylish yet welcoming interiors offer ample space for quiet afternoon downtime or festive evenings. Each villa includes a fully equipped kitchen, private dining room, and living area. Prepare a platter of meze to enjoy in the lounge before a home-cooked feast of local seafood and wine. Then pour glasses of ouzo from the wet bar to sip by the fire.Villa Selenia Platinum is the larger house, with 5 deluxe queen bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms, accommodating 10 guests. Villa Selenia Gold has 2 queen bedrooms, accommodating up to 4 guests. The spacious master and primary guest suites include elevated, in-room bathtubs with spa jets.From its private perch in the Aeolos housing estate, Villa Selenia offers a wonderful experience of the Palaia Fokaia region, close to rustic villages, ancient archeological sites, and stunning beaches. Behold the famous sunsets from the Temple of Poseidon on Cape Sounio, about 8 kilometers away. Visit the charming, off-the-tourist radar Port of Lavrio, savoring the delicacies of its tavernas and catching a ferry to explore the Cyclades Islands. The myriad treasures of Athens are about 40 minutes away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Turquoise pops out in the pool, cushions, and views at this streamlined villa on a hill overlooking the Adriatic. Built on a backdrop of neutral stone and blond wood, this contemporary home shows its true colors in playful accents and a sun-splashed terrace. Walk 5 minutes to the pebbled shores of the nearest beach and 12 minutes to the local-favorite beach—and cafes and ice-cream spots—in Mlini.Watch the sun move across the sea from a terrace with a heated infinity pool, a tempting row of loungers, an outdoor kitchen with a barbecue, and a dining table where you can sit down to dinner or linger over a glass of Croatian wine. Inside, the villa has a smart TV with cable and satellite service, Wi-Fi, and a games room where you can challenge friends and family over the pool and ping-pong tables.A glass wall divides the terrace from the open-concept great room, flooding this vacation rental with sunlight. Gray sofas in the sitting area match the gray dining chairs and steel-toned cabinets in the fully equipped kitchen, and a few cerulean pieces match the hue of the sea outside.This luxury property has 3 bedrooms with king beds and sea views: 1 with a private ensuite bathroom and 2 that share access to a hall bathroom. For larger parties on holiday together, there’s also a spare room with a twin sofa bed and access to a shared bathroom.The villa is close to several beaches where you can swim in clear waters or take a honeymoon-style stroll along the shore. The nearest is 5 minutes away, close enough for a pre-coffee swim in the mornings, but it’s well worth walking the 12 minutes to Mlini Beach, a cafe-lined stretch frequented by locals. Kupari Beach, a 5-minute drive away, has beautiful water backed by the intriguing ruins of a resort, and Banje Beach, 15 minutes by car, lies just outside Dubrovnik’s old town.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Construction Note: Please note that there is construction near to this villa. Please inquire with one of our Villa Specialists for further details.Golf Digest and The World Golf Awards have both recognized Quinta do Lago as “Europe’s Best Golf Destination," and at Villa Golf Poente, you’ll be nearby all three of their amazing courses. With six en-suite bedrooms and accommodations for twelve, this villa is the perfect host for a golf trip with friends and family. Throughout the vast estate, you’ll find plenty of indoor, and outdoor, areas with space for the whole group to gather.From the terrace to the living room, the open-air design of this villa is sure to have you and your guests enjoying the social, free-flowing atmosphere created when indoor and outdoor spaces merge so seamlessly. Stone columns and archways, terracotta highlights, and elegant designer furniture are Golfe poente’s decor, all trademarks of luxurious Spanish colonial style.After a long day on the course, come home and cool off in the swimming pool, stretch out in a lounger, or kick back in the media room for a relaxing evening. Maybe the chef in your group is eager to get started on dinner. If so, there’s a fully equipped kitchen with high-end appliances, a Nespresso machine, breakfast bar, and formatting dining for eight. There’s also a barbecue and alfresco dining for twelve on the terrace. If you’d prefer to dine out, there are restaurants and shops located within the resort, as well as, tennis courts, a fitness center, and bicycle rentals.The, recently redesigned, North Course at Quinta do Lago is the perfect place to start your golf trip, with four tee locations on every hole, this course can accommodate players of all skill levels. Once you’re warmed up, visit the Laranjal Course for a more challenging journey through Algarve’s rolling terrain, making shot selection even more important. If you make it out of Laranjal, The South Course is considered to be Quinta do Lago’s crown jewel. Overlooking the Ria Formosa National Park, this course navigates its way through umbrella pines, lakes, and wildflowers for a scenic and challenging eighteen holes.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Get a taste of life in the Tuscan countryside at villa Fagnana. The restored farm, whose eight bedrooms are divided between a former farmhouse and barn, offers a quiet, private getaway spot that’s still conveniently close to cities like Pisa, Florence, Siena and Lucca. Enjoy the timeless setting of rolling hills dotted with traditional buildings from a home that’s been updated with modern luxuries.The property’s outdoor spaces make it easy to appreciate its rural setting on an estate once owned by the bankers to the Medici family. The kitchen and living room open to a large terrace with a barbecue shaded dining table, and a smaller table perfect for breakfast or a snack. Down a flight of steps, you’ll find the inground pool, which is surrounded by its own terrace, loungers and gazebo. The villa itself is air-conditioned and has Wi-Fi in the main areas and a VoIP phone, plus a laptop, iPod and baby equipment upon request.Fagnana’s interiors still have their traditional bones but have been given a fresh, modern update. In the living rooms, you’ll find classic Tuscan Cotto floors, large fireplaces, and beamed ceilings set off by clean-lined, neutral-toned sofas and glass-topped side tables. The quiet, spacious dining room pairs an antique console with a simple farmhouse table and chairs. In the kitchen, which is open to the dining room, modern appliances like a large gas range are tucked into pale wood cabinets and open upper shelving.There are seven bedrooms in the main house and one bedroom in the former barn (now a guest cottage). In the main house, the ground floor features a bedroom with a queen bed and an en-suite bathroom. Upstairs, you’ll find two bedrooms with a king bed and en-suite bathroom and two bedrooms with a queen bed and shared bathroom. A bedroom with a single bed and another bedroom with a single bed share a bathroom. In the guest cottage, there’s a bedroom with a king bed and en-suite bathroom.Since Fagnana is located on a 1,700-acre estate, there’s plenty to explore on foot, like the private church that’s a 15-minute walk away. By car, it’s 10 minutes to shopping, dining and a tennis court in the town of Forcoli, and 15 minutes to the hospital and train station in Pontedera. Just 20 minutes away, you’ll find the Castelfalfi golf course, and the beaches in Pisa and Tirrenia are 45 minutes away. The Pisa airport is 40 minutes away, and the Florence airport is a 60-minute drive.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: Villa Saletta estate, once owned by the Riccardi family (bankers to the Medici), covers approximately 1,760 acres. In total, there are more than 20 old farmhouses on the estate, mostly dating back to the 1800s. Each one has its own story to tell, being unique and individual in size and location.
Three of these farmhouses have been restored so far. Every restored villa has its own private grounds with electric gates, outdoor swimming pool, barbecue and comfortable shaded seating areas.

It was then refurbished in 2004 to give it an updated feel and add more modern conveniences. It is set on very private, secure grounds and, being situated in the hills, provides excellent views towards Pisa and spectacular sunsets.
Opposite the main entrance to the house is the Limonaia, a separate building which has a large double bedroom with en-suite bathroom.

An open terrace for outdoor dining runs the length of the house at the rear, complete with barbeque. The terrace overlooks the private, enclosed garden featuring a large area of lawn with mature olive trees and attractive flower beds. A swimming pool with its own sun terrace completes the picture.
Please note estate roads are not suitable for vehicles with poor ground clearance

listing.listing_description: The hot colors of Warhol’s Marilyns pop against the cool blue of the sea at this modern retreat near Trogir and Split. Pop-art works throughout the house play on comic strips and classic films, while a pool, alfresco lounging area, and optional extras like a motorboat and jet skis are meant for playing outside. There are sea views aplenty from the villa and it’s a 3-minute walk to the beach.Make the most of the villa’s south-facing hillside location in outdoor living areas with a heated infinity pool, barbecue, loungers, rowing machine, and a dining table for 8. As the light fades on the white faces of the homes on the neighboring island of Solta, step inside to turn on the satellite TV, LCD projector, and Sonos sound system, or share photos of your holiday over Wi-Fi.This luxury property is classic Croatia: red-roofed homes spilling over the hills outside, and sleek contemporary architecture inside. It’s all centered on an open-concept great room with nearly wall-to-wall glass, where the sitting area, dining area, and fully equipped kitchen all boast sea views.There are 2 bedrooms with king beds at this vacation rental and 2 bedrooms with 2 twin beds each; all 4 have private ensuite bathrooms, and 3 of the 4 open to a balcony or terrace. Each one is a honeymoon-worthy hideaway with colorful bedding, large-scale artwork, and Instagram-friendly details like a neon sign or sea views.The villa is a 3-minute walk from the nearest beach and a short drive from 2 other beaches, including the stretch known as Copacabana for its white shores, turquoise water, and array of restaurants and bars. The Okrug Gornji location is also a 13-minute drive to the medieval walls of old-town Trogir, where you can explore as a family or catch up over drinks as a couple.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Once a farmhouse and hayloft, the recently restored villa Valle is now a luxurious country retreat. With seven bedrooms divided between the main house and guest cottage and expansive yet private outdoor spaces, the property gives guests plenty of room to relax. But it’s also in the heart of Tuscany, close enough to the cities of Pisa, Florence, Siena and Lucca for day trips.Restored in 2007, the villa is now air-conditioned and has a Wi-Fi connection and gated access. The enclosed garden has a broad lawn and bocce court, and the main house and guest cottage are connected by a terrace with a pool, barbecue and outdoor dining area. Adults can while away the afternoon over a book in the sun room, and kids can entertain themselves in the billiards room.The interiors of Valle are warm and comfortable, drawing country charm from restored rustic fireplaces and beamed ceilings in the living spaces. With warm yellow walls, damask drapes and traditional-style furnishings, the living room is cozy and welcoming. A formal dining room is decorated in rich, earthy Tuscan reds and golds that glow under a chandelier and sconces. The sunny, modern eat-in kitchen has stainless steel appliances and a breakfast bar.There are five bedrooms in the villa’s main house and two bedrooms in the guest cottage. In the main house, you’ll find three bedrooms with king beds, one bedroom with a double bed and one bedroom with a queen bed. Each of the five bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom and air conditioning. In the guest house, there’s one bedroom with a double bed and one bedroom with a single bed; both are air-conditioned and have bathroom access.During your stay, take the time to stroll the estate on which the villa is located, or walk to the local church, 15 minutes away. By car, it’s only 5 minutes to downtown, which offers a grocery store, restaurant and seasonal truffle sales and tastings. A tennis court and clinic are 10 minutes away, and a hospital and train station are 36 km away. Enjoy a leisurely afternoon at the golf course, 45 km away, or the beach, 48 km away. When it’s time to leave, it’s a 35 km drive to the airport.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This stunning luxury apartment is located at the very heart of historic Rome, with expansive views of the Barcaccia Fountain and the Spanish Steps from its ample dining room and balcony. Part of the Spagna Royal Suite Hotel, the residence is exquisitely furnished and offers ample private space for savoring privacy with loved-ones, while the prime location in Campo Marzio places you within steps of Via Condotti and myriad Roman attractions.Three king bedroom suites and total accommodations for six upto 12 adults make The Club at the Spanish Steps a fabulous choice for families and multiple couples.The centerpiece of the home is its extraordinary dining room. French bay windows open to a balcony with breathtaking views of the Piazza di Spagna, while its circular table seats eight on velvet chairs. A palette of mauve, violet, and burnt teal complements chevron parquet floors, illuminated by copious natural light and a beautiful chandelier. Beyond the dining room, multiple lounge areas invite you to savor digestivi at night or a morning espresso before the day's foray on the city. The kitchen is fully equipped, and there is a conference room for business travelers.Each bedroom suite is like a luxury apartment unto itself, with a king bed, minibar, espresso machine, safe, TV, and ensuite bathroom. One of the bathrooms has dual showers, while the other two have one shower each. There are also two sofa beds in the living room that can accommodate children or extra guests. Air conditioning and heating ensure comfort in all seasons.There is hardly a finer location from which to experience the ancient spirit and vibrant contemporary scene of the Eternal City. You're directly across from the Spanish Steps and the Keats-Shelley Memorial House, and a few paces from the famed designer boutiques of Via Condotti. Enjoy an easy stroll to the Trevi Fountain, and continue to Piazza del Popolo or the world-renowned art collection of the Villa Borghese. Countless iconic destinations are within five to fifteen minutes by car, and the city's two major airports are both within a half-hour of your door.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: With Florence and Brunelleschi’s Dome in the distance, Limonaia La Gressa boasts one of the best views in all of Tuscany. Only seven kilometers from the city, this vacation rental is close enough to enjoy all of Florence’s major attractions, but far enough to peacefully luxuriate in the home’s lush garden and open-air terrace.Recently renovated, Limonaia La Gressa meets the highest standards of luxury vacation rentals without disturbing any of its original elements, like terracotta flooring, rugged exposed-beam ceilings, and stone terrace. Inside, the villa’s rooms are linked with beautiful arched doorways and decorated with stately designer furnishings. The fully equipped kitchen features stainless steel appliances, thick-cut granite countertops, and a brilliant backsplash. Underneath chandelier lighting, your group will love enjoying meals and celebrating special occasions in the elegant formal dining room. And, with several lounge spaces and smaller sitting areas, both inside and out, you’ll have no trouble orchestrating group gatherings or sneaking away for more intimate moments.Outside, you’ll love the view from the heated swimming pool and surrounding sun lounger chairs. For a casual lunch, fire up the pizza oven or barbeque and dine alfresco under the covered portion of the terrace. Back inside, you’ll appreciate Wi-Fi, a sound system, cable television, and air conditioning. And, when it’s time to retire for the evening, all five of Limonaia La Gressa’s beautiful bedrooms come with lavish en-suite bathrooms, and either a king or a pair of twin sized beds.Ten minutes from the villa, you’ll find the Stibbert Museum, containing thousands of artifacts from Eastern and Western civilizations. Travel just a little bit further and you’ll hit Fiesole’s Roman Theatre and Piazza Della Liberta, both about seven-kilometers from home. And, just eleven-kilometers from home, the seemingly endless supply of museums, art galleries, historic sites, monuments, and nightlife of Florence, Italy await you on your next Luxury Retreats vacation.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Add wow factor to your ski holiday with a stay at Chalet Couttet. This luxury property boasts resort-worthy amenities in a private, five-bedroom setting that can accommodate up to ten friends or family members. A location just minutes from the center of Chamonix puts you close to some of the best skiing in the French Alps.Summer stays at this vacation rental include a daily cleaning, bread and pastry delivery, and a welcome basket, chef and driver service, and a champagne reception on arrival. The villa has its own outdoor living areas with a heated pool, hot tub, barbecue and garden, as well as a home theater, gym, hammam, spa and games room inside.Modeled on the classic ski lodge, with a pitched roof, beamed ceilings and cozy wood paneling, Chalet Couttet puts a modern twist on that traditional style. Its open-concept living room, dining room and fully equipped kitchen feature sleek yet comfortable furnishings, bold patterns, a minimalist wood-burning fireplace and state-of-the-art appliances.The chalet has three bedrooms with king beds and balconies overlooking the mountains, including two master suites, one bedroom with a queen bed and one bedroom with a double bed. All five bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms. Like the common areas, the suites are stylish yet cozy, with wood-paneled walls and serene neutral tones.Made famous by its hosting of the Winter Olympics, Chamonix is the quintessential Alpine resort town—and its charming downtown is just minutes from Chalet Couttet. Find everything from an apres-ski snack to honeymoon-worthy dining at a Michelin-starred restaurant in the town center. If you’re in town to ski, you’ll find the Chamonix, Mercure les Bossons and Mont Blanc resorts within easy reach—especially if you ask the driver to bring you there during the season.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Discover Sicily’s timeless beauty from this stone-clad villa steps away from Minareto Beach in Siracusa. Embrace the ease of resort life, while lush private gardens and stone walls carve out a secluded piece of the peninsula just for you. After a day on the beach, treat yourself to a traditional Sicilian dinner and a little shopping on the winding streets of Siracusa.Work on your tan in one of the poolside sun loungers on the back patio. When you’re ready to cool off, jump into the plunge pool for instant refreshment. Then, move inside to the air conditioning to catch up on some ready in a leather armchair. If you’re feeling inspired, try your hand at Sicilian cuisine in the kitchen and whip up a light lunch to enjoy at the alfresco set.If you’re committed to any workout routines, the Minareto Resort has a fully-equipped gym that is ready when you are. Keep up with the rest of the World on Wi-Fi and satellite television. If you want. And, check out the resort’s list of add-on features to customize your vacation. The villa comes with housekeeping, parking, and access to the private beach.Take a walking tour of Siracusa and see what it’s like to be a local. Stop in for fresh pastries at family-owned bakeries, sample wine from nearby vineyards, and dine at some of the city’s most buzzing patio restaurants. The next day, plan a trip to Noto, Ragusa, or Taormina, all of which are drivable in an hour or so. Or visit Mount Etna Volcano, the still-active stratovolcano, 105 kilometers from home. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Learn the secrets of wine country at this elegant vineyard estate in Saint-Estephe, France. Explore the entire Cos d’Estournel operation, from harvest to tasting while you’re pampered by a full staff, including a private gourmet chef for all meals. After you’ve wandered the gardens, sampled the vintage collection, and embraced the Medoc lifestyle, head to Bordeaux for a custom-designed city tour. You may need a few days to fully take in La Chartreuse, to discover the many functions and traditions of the winery. Luckily, you’ll be living in a mansion decorated with stately furnishings, chandelier lighting, and authentic French architecture. Outside, lush gardens, vineyard, and decorative fountains create endless settings for sipping Espresso, wine tasting, and alfresco dining. When you’re on a break from your lessons in wine crafting, rejuvenate in the hammam, spa, or one of the swimming pools. The library is a great place to catch up on some reading. And, there’s a state of the art home gym in case you feel like maintaining your workout routine. The villa comes with Wi-Fi, television, and air conditioning, as well as a full-staff and numerous tours and activities.After you’ve taken the guided tour of Bordeaux and visited the historical, architectural, and cultural sites, stick around for a night on the town. Qais de Bordeaux is a beautiful waterfront setting where you’ll find delicious cuisine, bustling bars, and even more wine. If you feel like working on your tan, Arcachon Bay’s golden shores and sparkling waters are about an hour from Chartreuse. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Enjoy sunny days and dreamy evenings at Sunset Paradise. As its name suggests, this beautiful vacation rental boasts incredible views off the west coast of Ibiza—not to mention a private setting and chic contemporary architecture. Its location near the resort of Cala Tarida is only minutes from the beach and a short drive from Ibiza Town and the airport.Soak in the Mediterranean sun from outdoor living areas with a pool, plenty of loungers, a ping-pong table, a barbecue and al-fresco dining for twelve. After watching the sun set over Conejera Island, watch the stars come out from the rooftop deck—or step inside to watch Apple TV and share photos of your holiday via Wi-Fi.Sliding glass doors, nearly floor-to-ceiling windows and an open-plan layout link the interiors of Sunset Paradise to the outdoor living areas. Neutral tones and natural textures lend a casual yet chic vibe to the open-concept living and dining areas, and in the fully equipped kitchen, flat-fronted cabinets are equally sleek and stylish.There are four bedrooms in the main house of this luxury property and two in the guest house; all six have en-suite bathrooms. The main house has three bedrooms with king beds, including a master suite with a jetted tub, and one with two twin beds. The guest house, with one king bedroom and one with two twin beds, could be used as a secluded honeymoon suite or quiet accommodations for a family with children.Though Sunset Paradise looks out over the sea and countryside, it’s less than a 10-minute drive from the nearest beach, the legendary Cova Santa venue and the town of San Jose. Restaurants and bars line the white sands of Cala Tarida, but if you’re looking for more excitement, Ibiza Town is only 20 minutes away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: With a sun-soaked terrace, private pool and location close to the beach, Alegre Belle offers the best of a warm-weather getaway in Ibiza in a thoughtful mid-century-inspired setting. The exterior is classic Ibiza, with sleek white walls and plenty of windows with views of the sea, but the cool, sophisticated interiors are filled with iconic pieces. Four bedrooms and spacious living areas provide enough room for families or groups of friends, but there’s a separate apartment, too, if you need it.A winding road leads you through a residential neighborhood to the gates of Alegre Belle. Spread out in front of the house are a deck with glass railings to preserve the views, an infinity pool, rows of lounge chairs and a barbecue. If the Mediterranean sun proves too much, seek shade under one of the sun umbrellas or in the covered outdoor sitting and dining areas. Entertain guests in the evening with the smart TV and Wi-Fi, and refresh towels and swimsuits in the laundry facilities.The villa’s stately wooden front door swings open to a great room with a bar corner, two sitting areas and views out to the hills and water. Gather to read or chat on the grouping of tan sofas around a natural wood coffee table, or sit in the Egg chairs around the limestone and granite fireplace to watch the television mounted on the surround. Windows on two sides of the dining room create a light, airy feel, and Louis Ghost chairs only enhance the sense of spaciousness. The bright, minimalist kitchen is fully equipped and has ultra-sleek white Boffi cabinets.Each of the four bedrooms at Alegre Belle has a king bed and en-suite bathroom with stand-alone shower. The master suite, which spreads out across the entire top floor, opens to its own terrace with a private al-fresco sitting area. The other three bedrooms are in a separate wing and offer ample space and privacy. On the lower level, you’ll find an additional bedroom with its own entrance, a king bed, en-suite bathroom and a kitchenette.Everything you need is within a short drive of Alegre Belle. It’s just 6 km to the Tropicana Beach Club, located on one of the island’s best beaches, and 16 km to the famed restaurants, nightlife and shopping in Ibiza Town. When it’s time to leave, plan on an 13 km drive to Ibiza Airport.Copyright © 2015 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Chamonix, the iconic French ski paradise, was the host of the first ever Winter Olympics in nineteen twenty-four. Since then, the quiet hamlet has been considered one of the most desirable ski locations in the world. Nestled in a valley between two mountains, Chalet Alta is the perfect home base for your French Alps ski vacation.Relaxing after a long day on the slopes is easy at Chalet Alta. Cool off in the indoor swimming pool, warm up in the sauna, or simply curl up by the wood burning fireplace. Alta’s media room is another great space for lounging with friends and family - featuring a wet bar stocked with beer, sprits, and soft drinks. Also included with the chalet rental are, chef services, daily housekeeping, in-resort chauffeur, breakfast, and a four course dinner served with wine, six nights a week.Built in the style of a traditional French ski lodge, Alta is warm, cozy, and inviting. Adding a twist of modern architecture, Smart Home technology and thoughtful design makes it the quintessential luxury ski chalet. The living room leans more to the traditional side of the spectrum with heated wood flooring, comfortable seating, and stone columns, all focused around a beautiful wood burning fireplace. The dining room features a large wood table, with space for twelve.Each of the five bedrooms at Alta has a double size bed, an ensuite bathroom, and direct access to the outside terrace. If you need space for kids or a few extra guests, three sets of bunk beds occupy the basement, allowing for Alta to house up to sixteen.If you feel like a trip in to town, Chamonix is an eight minute drive from the chalet. Home to beautiful restaurants, cafés, nightlife, and boutique shops, it’s a charming town to spend an afternoon exploring.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Offering cultured and luxurious accommodation with great access to some of the best sights in Venice, guests will find this apartment exceedingly well-located. Offering dashes of Italian craftsmanship via the ornate fireplace and greenstone washbasin, the sumptuous furniture and in-house AC add character and comfort, with the Gallerie dell'Accademia and St Mark’s Basilica just a short walk away.Touches of old-world charm run throughout this apartment, ranging from the exposed rafters to the classically-inspired art pieces that decorate each room. Relaxing in the living room, guests will appreciate the rich and plush couches, before standing to take in an impressive view of the nearby flagstone-paved piazza. This completely restored apartment makes self-catering exceedingly simple, with a fully-equipped kitchen and innovative dining area allowing guests to dine in style, with the supplied satellite TV and central heating system ensuring that time spent in the apartment is completely comfortable.From this apartment, guests can rest easy that the best aspects of Venice are nearby. A short walk will take you to the banks of the Grand Canal, while gelato, fire-baked pizza and famous Venetian coffee is just steps away. The must-see facade of St Mark’s Basilica is similarly close by, while the graceful arches of the Rialto Bridge, rising over the blue waters of the canal, are likewise just a short walk away. The priceless historical artworks of the Gallerie dell'Accademia are also in the neighborhood. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
